definition: both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: The two sides since the debate continues.
sentences.chinese: 两方辩论至今仍在继续。

sentences.english: The week-old peace talks there between the two sides were near collapse.
sentences.chinese: 两方在该处持续一周的和谈快将破裂。

sentences.english: We can discuss it and pro-and-con it.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以讨论甚至从正反两方面辩论这件事。

sentences.english: Devices also may use the authentication mechanism to establish two-party secure subnetworks .
sentences.chinese: 设备也能使用认证机制，建立两方的安全子网。

sentences.english: The controversies are those about matters as to which there is no good.
sentences.chinese: 最激烈的争论乃是关于正反两方都无充分证据的事物。

sentences.english: "I hope the debate goes slowly, " he says, "because there are risks on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 我希望辩论缓慢地进行，因为正反两方面都存在风险。

sentences.english: He bought two high quality inkstones.
sentences.chinese: 他买了两方质地优良的端砚。

sentences.english: Not only will it be very interesting and fun, it's also a way to improve understanding about eachother.
sentences.chinese: 不但会很有意思，很好玩，但是也会给两方带来了解。

sentences.english: He believes the two parts of north and south Korea will reunite sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 他相信南北朝鲜两方迟早会重新统一。

sentences.english: The committee found a middleground between the two proposals.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在两方提案中采取了两面兼顾的决定。

sentences.english: Well, either side could win it, or it could be a draw.
sentences.chinese: 两方中的一方会赢，否则就是一场平局。

sentences.english: Could you copy these both onto one piece of paper using the front and back?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这份文件复印在同一张纸的正反两方吗？

sentences.english: Must control the application of the death penalty with reprieve from the procedure and substantiality.
sentences.chinese: 必须从程序和实体两方面对死缓制度的适用进行控制。

sentences.english: Both drivers were breathalysed at the scene of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 两方司机均在事故现场接受了呼气酒精检测。

sentences.english: Way of reversing of studying the relation of Japanese while discussing from two aspects on translating and studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 从翻译和游学两方面谈中日文学关系的逆转途径。

sentences.english: Waistband on the sides in each of a nylon buckle, very strong.
sentences.chinese: 裤腰上左右两方各有一个尼龙的扣，非常结实。

definition: at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
a party (in a contract or legal case)/one side/area/region
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
neither giving way to the other
